title: Luiz Antônio
text:
Luiz Antônio Moraes (born November 30, 1970) is a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former player. A <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>, Antônio played most of his professional career in Finland.
Luiz Antônio won two Finnish championships with <a href="FC%20Jazz">FC Jazz</a>. He was the top scorer of <a href="Veikkausliiga">Veikkausliiga</a> in <a href="1992%20Veikkausliiga">1992</a> and <a href="1996%20Veikkausliiga">1996</a>. Antônio also had two <a href="Finnish%20Cup">Finnish Cup</a> titles with <a href="Helsingin%20Jalkapalloklubi">HJK Helsinki</a>. He played total 196 games in Veikkausliiga, scoring 94 goals. In <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> club competitions Antônio scored four times, including two goals for HJK in <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">1998–99 Champions League</a> group stage.
